intro: Herniaria pauciflora, commonly known as the lesser bladderwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, green, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal areas or disturbed sites. Herniaria pauciflora is adapted to arid environments and has a unique ability to retain moisture in its succulent tissues.
